rev.comment: Rm non-free gallery per [[WP:NFG]] and one image failing [[WP:NFCC]] #10c
rev.diff:
Line 25: Line 25:
For a number of years prior to [[2009 in radio|2009]], this was a [[rhythmic contemporary]] station, "Blazin' 98.9". Market competitors included [[XHITZ-FM|XHITZ]] licensed to Mexico and [[KHTS-FM|KHTS]] licensed to the United States. In 2009, the music stopped and the station adopted a [[sports radio]] format and was the local [[ESPN Radio]] affiliate. On [[October 6]], [[2010 in radio|2010]], ESPN Radio was replaced by the current format and the language of broadcasts changed from [[English language|English]] to [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. The current ESPN Radio affiliates are [[XEPRS-AM|XEPRS]] and [[XEPE-AM|XEPE]].
For a number of years prior to [[2009 in radio|2009]], this was a [[rhythmic contemporary]] station, "Blazin' 98.9". Market competitors included [[XHITZ-FM|XHITZ]] licensed to Mexico and [[KHTS-FM|KHTS]] licensed to the United States. In 2009, the music stopped and the station adopted a [[sports radio]] format and was the local [[ESPN Radio]] affiliate. On [[October 6]], [[2010 in radio|2010]], ESPN Radio was replaced by the current format and the language of broadcasts changed from [[English language|English]] to [[Spanish language|Spanish]]. The current ESPN Radio affiliates are [[XEPRS-AM|XEPRS]] and [[XEPE-AM|XEPE]].
